title: Dark clouds, silver linings: Five ways war in Ukraine is transforming the space domain
summary: The article discusses the broader geopolitical and industrial impacts of the war in Ukraine on the space sector, including increased reliance on commercial satellite services, shifts in launch dependencies, and investments in European space autonomy. ICEYE is mentioned as one of the companies providing synthetic aperture radar imagery for Ukraine, but no concrete deal involving ICEYE is described.
why_it_matters: The war has accelerated trends in commercial space utilization and highlighted the strategic importance of space assets, but the article does not detail any specific corporate transaction or deal involving ICEYE or other entities.

entities.name: ICEYE
entities.involvement: mentioned as supplying synthetic aperture radar imagery for Ukraine

entities.name: Maxar
entities.involvement: provided satellite imagery for Ukraine and media

entities.name: European Space Agency (ESA)
entities.involvement: investing in European autonomy and IRIS2 constellation
